channel.title: Sublimetext on Moselog
channel.description: Recent content in Sublimetext on Moselog

item.title: Dictionnary in sublimetext
item.description: I recently have been annoyed by his own typoes and has been looking for a way to fix it. This is actually pretty simple to cmd-shift-p and install a package called Dictionnaries. Then by hitting F6 you switch on and off the spellcheck highlighting. When you write a lot of documentation that is very helpful (and you want to write a lot of documentation, don’t you ?). The spellcheck auto-highlight can be enabled for specific file extensions (like .

item.title: Sublimetext2, plugins, sshfs
item.description: For 15 years I have been using vim and I don’t like IDEs. Of course I had to use eclipse and netbeans sometimes when coding in java. Java probably can’t be really well handled without a full-blown IDE anyways.But I didn’t like it, you get distance from your code, stuff happens behind the scene and I like to keep visibility on everything that happens. But since I went into rails, I tried what was out there and there is a popular editor for the few rails coder that use Linux and not mac, called sublimetext2.
